definition: to lose one's eyesight/to become blind/blindness
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Going blind was the watershed of my life.
sentences.chinese: 失明成为我人生的一个分水岭。

sentences.english: The nose and eyes bleed and loss of vision occurs, with subsequent loss of consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 鼻子和眼睛都会出血，接着失明，慢慢失去意识。

sentences.english: To take Hellon as an example, blindness is sometimes quite an exciting experience.
sentences.chinese: 以海伦来说吧，有时候失明是相当好旳经验。

sentences.english: He was momentarily blinded by the reflection of the sun off his watch.
sentences.chinese: 手表反射的太阳光让他有一霎那的失明。

sentences.english: Crape myrtle in exile, head injury and blindness.
sentences.chinese: 紫薇在逃亡中，头部受创而失明。

sentences.english: But Ada had never learned to ride a bike. Ada was blind.
sentences.chinese: 不过艾达因为失明，所以从来没有学过骑自行车。

sentences.english: We would like to donate to ORBIS and help restoring sight of blind people worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 我们愿意捐助奥比斯，帮助世上失明人士重见光明。

sentences.english: If touched, one should never touch ones eyes; it can cause partial or permanent blindness.
sentences.chinese: 如果触摸了就不可触摸眼睛，会使一个人永久失明。

sentences.english: The fear of blindness leaves patients terrified of ocular injury.
sentences.chinese: 失明的危险让病人们对眼外伤感到恐惧。

sentences.english: I feared blindness would set in at any moment.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕在任何时刻失明的突然降临。

sentences.english: Then I was switched to another teacher in the same studio. A blind male teacher.
sentences.chinese: 然后不知怎的我又再次换了另一名失明的男老师。

sentences.english: You can go blind if you gets white lime in your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 消石灰进入人的眼睛可能会导致失明。

sentences.english: She lost her eyesight at 19 months.
sentences.chinese: 她19个月的时候就失明了。

sentences.english: In fact, the key complex of it is whether Goethe is blind .
sentences.chinese: 其实，浮士德失明与否是全剧的关键情结。

sentences.english: Most people, when asked, claim they would rather lose their hearing than their sight.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人被问起时都会说他们宁可失聪也不愿失明。

sentences.english: My company would like to help ORBIS restore sight of blind people worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 本公司愿意捐助奥比斯，帮助失明人士重見光明。

definition: paralysis of one side of the body/hemiplegia
to be crippled (in an accident etc)
disabled/handicapped/deformity on a person or animal
person in a vegetative state/human vegetable
